page.title: 13THE COLWYN BAY PIONEER
page.content: The Pioneer is a local{newspaper}which ceased production during the war.It was relaunched in 1971.Until about two years ago a charge was made for the paper,but it is now distributed {free to about{30 000}homes and offices every week.The weekly production costs of roughly Â£7 000 are met by revenue from advertising;items for sale,wanted or lost;jobs and services etc..30% of space is reserved for news or comment. Over recent months the topics most frequently in the headlines have included the construction of the new {express way}and the effect that it is having on the community eg.demolition of houses,loss or increase of trade, ease of access to the area by both tourists and burglars.Also in the news are cuts in local services _ currently the proposed abolition of nursery education for three year olds.
